oneOf.comment: Historical size selection methods, not valid for new submissions.

72 degrees for 3 minutes in the presence of Triton

average_fragment_size.description: The average size of a fragment in the library, in bp.

fragment_length_SD.description: The standard deviation for the size distribution of library fragments.

biosample_term_id.comment: NTR is a new term request identifier provided by the DCC.

Biosample.title: Biosample
Biosample.comment: For cultured samples this object represents unique growths or culture harvests.

post_synchronization_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_synchronization_units requires post_synchronization_time specification and specification of the model organism synchronization stage.

post_treatment_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_treatment_time requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time_units specification.

post_treatment_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_treatment_time_units requires non-empty treatments list post_treatment_time specification.

post_differentiation_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_differentiation_time requires post_differentiation_time_units specification.

post_differentiation_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_differentiation_time_units requires post_differentiation_time specification.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.comment: Biosample with a specified post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units specification.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.comment: Biosample with a specified post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time specification.

pooled_from.comment: Biosample with a specified pooled_from list requires at least two entries in the list.

starting_amount.comment: Biosamples with a specified starting_amount require starting_amount_units to also be specified.

starting_amount_units.comment: Biosamples with a specified starting_amount_units require starting_amount to also be specified.

PMI.comment: Tissue biosamples with a specified PMI require PMI_units to also be specified.

PMI_units.comment: Tissue biosamples with a specified PMI_units require PMI to also be specified.

model_organism_age_units.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_age_units requires model_organism_age specification.

model_organism_age.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_age requires model_organism_age_units specification.

model_organism_mating_status.comment: Biosample with a specified model_organism_mating_status requires model_organism_sex specification.

organism.comment: Human biosamples are not allowed to have model organism properties, and biosample_ontology classification should be different from whole organisms.

post_synchronization_time.comment: Human and mouse biosamples are not allowed to have post_synchronization_time property. Biosample with a specified post_synchronization_time requires post_synchronization_time_units specification and model organism synchronization stage.

fly_life_stage.comment: Only fly biosamples are allowed to have fly_life_stage property.

fly_synchronization_stage.comment: Only fly biosamples are allowed to have fly_synchronization_stage property.

worm_synchronization_stage.comment: Only roundworm biosamples are allowed to have worm_synchronization_stage property.

worm_life_stage.comment: Only roundworm biosamples are allowed to have worm_life_stage property.

mouse_life_stage.comment: Only mouse biosamples are allowed to have mouse_life_stage property.

allOf.comment: Only human biosamples can specify the age it was collected.

sample_collection_age_units.comment: Age units is required if age is specified as anything but unknown.

pulse_chase_time.comment: Biosamples with a specified pulse_chase_time require pulse_chase_time_units to also be specified.

pulse_chase_time_units.comment: Biosamples with a specified pulse_chase_time_units require pulse_chase_time to also be specified.

references.description: The publications that provide more information about the object.

lot_id.description: The lot identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

product_id.description: The product identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

biosample_ontology.title: Biosample ontology
biosample_ontology.description: An embeded property for linking to biosample type which describes the ontology of the biosample.

genetic_modifications.title: Genetic modifications
genetic_modifications.description: Genetic modification(s). Any genetic alteration of a biosample or donor.
genetic_modifications.comment: Constructs, TALENs, and RNAi objects have been migrated to the GeneticModification object.

items.title: Genetic modification
items.description: Genetic modification(s).
items.comment: See genetic_modification.json for available identifiers.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

description.title: Description
description.description: A plain text description of the biosample. Do not include experiment details, genetic modifications or treatments.
description.comment: Free text description of the biosample, do not mix with biosample summary that is calculated and controlled.

elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.title: Field mapping index type
elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.description: Defines one of three types of indexing available

treatments.title: Treatments
treatments.description: A list of treatments applied to the biosample.
treatments.comment: A list of treatments applied to the biosample, it is required to be non-empty if post_treatment_time or post_treatment_time_units are specified.

items.title: Treatment
items.comment: See treatment.json for available identifiers.

dbxrefs.title: External resources
dbxrefs.description: Biosample identifiers from external resources, such as Biosample database or Cellosaurus.
dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit. DCC personnel is responsible for submission of biosample external resource identifiers.

items.title: External identifier
items.description: An identifier from external resource.

donor.title: Donor
donor.description: The donor or strain the biosample was originated from.
donor.comment: For human biosamples, see human_donor.json for available identifiers. For mouse biosamples, see mouse_donor.json for available identifiers. For worm biosamples, see worm_donor.json for available identifiers. For fly biosamples, see fly_donor.json for available identifiers. For manatee biosamples, see manatee_donor.json for available identifiers.

organism.title: Organism
organism.description: The organism the biosample was originated from.

sample_collection_age.title: Sample collection age
sample_collection_age.description: The age or age range of the donor when the biosample was collected.
sample_collection_age.comment: This is designed specifically for cases where more than one biosamples are collected from the same human donor at different ages. Otherwise, you can considering using the age property of human donor.

passage_number.title: Passage number
passage_number.description: Number of passages including the passages from the source.
passage_number.comment: In calculating passage number, include passages from the source.

depleted_in_term_name.title: Depleted in term
depleted_in_term_name.description: UBERON (Uber Anatomy Ontology) term best matching the tissue(s)/body part(s) that were removed from the biosample.

model_organism_mating_status.title: Model organism mating status
model_organism_mating_status.description: The mating status of the animal.
model_organism_mating_status.comment: The value is not available for human biosamples.

internal_tags.title: Internal tags
internal_tags.description: Some biosamples are part of particular data collections.
internal_tags.comment: Do not submit. Internal tags are for DCC use only.

originated_from.title: Originated from
originated_from.description: A biosample that the sample was orginated from.

pooled_from.title: Pooled from
pooled_from.description: The biosamples from which aliquots were pooled to form the biosample.
pooled_from.comment: A list of biosamples used to create the biosample, if specified, it requires minimum of two entries.

items.description: A biosample from which an aliquot was taken to form the biosample.
items.comment: See biosample.json for available identifiers.

part_of.title: Separated from
part_of.description: A biosample from which a discrete component was taken. That component is this biosample.

host.title: Host biosample
host.description: A biosample that was hosting this biosample.
host.comment: For example a mouse could be a host of bone marrow biosample in case of transplantation. See biosamples.json for available identifiers.

subcellular_fraction_term_name.title: Subcellular fraction
subcellular_fraction_term_name.description: The GO (Gene Ontology) term name for cellular component that constitutes the biosample.

phase.title: Cell cycle phase
phase.description: Specification of cell cycle phase of the biosample.
phase.comment: The phase property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].

culture_harvest_date.title: Culture harvest date
culture_harvest_date.description: For cultured samples, the date the biosample was taken.
culture_harvest_date.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD. The property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].

culture_start_date.title: Culture start date
culture_start_date.description: For cultured samples, the date the culture was started. For cell lines, the date this particular growth was started, not the date the line was established.
culture_start_date.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD. The property should be limited to biosamples with biosample_ontology classification that belongs to [primary cell, cell line, in vitro differentiated cells].

date_obtained.title: Date obtained
date_obtained.description: For tissue samples, the date the biosample was taken.
date_obtained.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD.

starting_amount.title: Starting amount
starting_amount.description: The initial quantity of cells, tissue or animals obtained.

starting_amount_units.title: Starting amount units
starting_amount_units.description: The units used to quantify the amount of cells or tissue obtained.

PMI.title: Post-mortem interval
PMI.description: The amount of time elapsed since death.
PMI.comment: Post-mortem interval for tissues should be reported, if known. Using for biosamples other than tissue is currently not allowed.

PMI_units.title: Post-mortem interval units
PMI_units.description: The unit in which the PMI time was reported.
PMI_units.comment: Post-mortem interval units for tissues should be reported with PMI value, if known. Using for biosamples other than tissue is currently not allowed.

preservation_method.title: Preservation method
preservation_method.description: The method by which the sample was preserved: cryopreservation (slow-freeze) or flash-freezing.
preservation_method.comment: Indicate the sample preservation_method if known and may be/become an experimental variable to track.

cell_isolation_method.title: Cell isolation method
cell_isolation_method.description: The method by which the cell(s) in the sampe were isolated.
cell_isolation_method.comment: Indicate the method used to isolate cell(s) in the sample. For example Fluidigm C1 cell isolation should specify: microfluidic cell sorting.

model_organism_sex.title: Model organism sex
model_organism_sex.description: The sex of the model organism the biosample comes from.
model_organism_sex.comment: model_organism_sex is not valid for a human biosample.

mouse_life_stage.title: Mouse life stage
mouse_life_stage.description: The life stage of the mouse biosample.
mouse_life_stage.comment: mouse_life_stage is not valid for a human biosample.

fly_life_stage.title: Fly life stage
fly_life_stage.description: Fly development stage of the animals used to prepare the biosample.
fly_life_stage.comment: fly_life_stage is valid only for fly biosamples.

fly_synchronization_stage.title: Fly synchronization stage
fly_synchronization_stage.description: Fly development stage at which flies were synchronized.
fly_synchronization_stage.comment: Stage at which flies were synchronized. If available use in conjunction with time and time units post-synchronization.
enum: puff stage: PS (1-2), dark blue gut
puff stage: PS (3-6), light blue gut

post_synchronization_time.title: Post-synchronization time
post_synchronization_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when animals were synchronized.
post_synchronization_time.comment: Use in conjunction with fly_synchronization_stage or worm_synchronization_stage to specify time elapsed post-synchronization. It requires specification of post_synchronization_time_units as well.

post_synchronization_time_units.title: Post-synchronization time units
post_synchronization_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when animals were synchronized.
post_synchronization_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with fly_synchronization_stage or worm_synchronization_stage and post_synchronization_time to specify time elapsed post-synchronization.

post_treatment_time.title: Post-treatment time
post_treatment_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were treated.
post_treatment_time.comment: Use in conjunction with treatment and post_treatment_time_units to specify time elapsed post-treatment. post_treatment_time specification requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time_units specification.

post_treatment_time_units.title: Post-treatment time units
post_treatment_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were treated.
post_treatment_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_treatment_time and treatment to specify time elapsed post-treatment. post_treatment_time_units specification requires non-empty treatments list and post_treatment_time specification.

post_differentiation_time.title: Post-differentiation time
post_differentiation_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were differentiated.
post_differentiation_time.comment: Use in conjunction with post_differentiation_time_units to specify time elapsed post-differentiation. Use of this property requires post_differentiation_time_units specification.

post_differentiation_time_units.title: Post-differentiation time units
post_differentiation_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when biosamples were differentiated.
post_differentiation_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_differentiation_time to specify time elapsed post-differentiation. Use of this property requires post_differentiation_time specification.

worm_life_stage.title: Worm life stage
worm_life_stage.description: Worm development stage of the animals used to prepare the biosample.
worm_life_stage.comment: worm_life_stage is valid only for worm biosamples.
enum: mixed stage (late embryonic and L1 larva)

worm_synchronization_stage.title: Worm synchronization stage
worm_synchronization_stage.description: Worm development stage at which the animals were synchronized.
worm_synchronization_stage.comment: Stage at which worms were synchronized. Use in conjunction with time and time units post-synchronization.  worm_life_stage is valid only for worm biosamples.

model_organism_age.title: Age
model_organism_age.description: The age or age range of the model donor organism when biological material was sampled.
model_organism_age.comment: model_organism_age is not valid for a human biosample.

model_organism_age_units.title: Age units
model_organism_age_units.description: Age units of the model organism.
model_organism_age_units.comment: model_organism_age_units are not valid for a human biosample.

model_organism_health_status.title: Model organism health status
model_organism_health_status.description: Health status of the model organism.
model_organism_health_status.comment: model_organism_health_status is not valid for a human biosample.

nih_institutional_certification.title: NIH institutional certification
nih_institutional_certification.description: Institutional certification given by the NIH for human biosamples.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.title: Post-nucleic acid delivery time
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.description: The time that elapsed past the point when nucleic acid was introduced into the biosample.
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time.comment: Use in conjunction with post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units to specify time elapsed post-nucleic acid delivery. Use of this property requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units specification.

post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.title: Post-nucleic acid delivery time units
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when nucleic acid was introduced into the biosample.
post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time to specify time elapsed post-nucleic acid delivery. Use of this property requires post_nucleic_acid_delivery_time specification.

disease_term_id.title: Disease ontology IDs
disease_term_id.description: Ontology identifiers describing the disease(s) affecting the biosample.

items.title: Disease ontology ID
items.description: Ontology identifier describing the disease affecting the biosample.

pulse_chase_time.title: Pulse-chase time
pulse_chase_time.description: The time that elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment.
pulse_chase_time.comment: Use in conjunction with pulse_chase_time_units to specify time elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment. Use of this property requires pulse_chase_time_units specification.

pulse_chase_time_units.title: Pulse-chase time units
pulse_chase_time_units.description: The units of time that elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment.
pulse_chase_time_units.comment: Use in conjunction with pulse_chase_time and treatment to specify time elapsed in the chase phase of a pulse-chase experiment. Use of this property requires pulse_chase_time specification.

disease_term_name.title: Disease term names

paired_with.comment: Only paired-ended files should have paired_with value.

run_type.comment: run_type should not be specified for PacBio platform FASTQ files. Illumina produced paired-ended files should have paired_end value specified.

external_accession.comment: A file with an external accession should not get an ENCODE accession.

revoke_detail.comment: Only revoked files can have revoke_detail specified.

hotspots_prefix.comment: Only files with output_type of hotspots1 reference or hotspots2 reference can have hotspots_prefix specified.

paired_end.comment: Files with paired-end value 2 require a paired_with value and files with paired_end specified require run_type to be specified as paired-ended

output_type.comment: Files with output_type reads or filtered reads and file format fastq, fatsa, csfasta, csqual and sra require read_length to be specified, unless the file was produced by PacBio, Nanopore, or Ultima platform. Files of output_type restriction enzyme site locations require specification of restriction_enzymes. Files of output_type index reads require specification of index_of.

fastq_signature.comment: Do not submit. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.

items.title: Flowcell based fastq signature part
items.description: Fastq file flowcell based unique signature to reference a file.
items.comment: Fastq signatures are generated from the sequence identifiers in fastq files. Current convention is based on the Illumina's unique sequence identifier, which is colon separated, flowcell ID, lane number, read_end(1/2/3), and unique barcode when applicable. For more information, please see doi.org/10.1093/database/bay008 or the ENCODE publication object: https://www.encodeproject.org/publications/c954afd6-12c5-4944-b8f7-0fa30ddb8336/

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The measurement device used to collect data.
platform.comment: This field is required for csfasta, csqual, rcc, idat and CEL file formats. See platform.json for identifer format.

read_length.title: Read length
read_length.description: For high-throughput sequencing, the number of contiguous nucleotides determined by sequencing.
read_length.comment: This field is required for fastq, fasta, csfasta, csqual and sra file formats containing sequencing reads.

run_type.title: Run type
run_type.description: Indicates if file is part of a single or paired end sequencing run
run_type.comment: This field is required for sra and fastq files.

paired_end.title: Paired end identifier
paired_end.description: Which read of the pair the file represents (in case of paired end sequencing run)
paired_end.comment: This field is required if run_type is paired-ended.

paired_with.title: Paired with
paired_with.description: The paired end fastq that corresponds with this file.
paired_with.comment: This is required for files with paired_end 2 and is calculated for files with paired_end 1.

cropped_read_length.title: Cropped read length (nt)
cropped_read_length.description: Length the FASTQ reads were cropped to prior to alignment.
cropped_read_length.comment: The actual read length could be up to 2 bp shorter than the specified cropped read length value.

cropped_read_length_tolerance.title: Cropped read length tolerance (nt)
cropped_read_length_tolerance.description: Tolerance for FASTQ read length after cropping.
cropped_read_length_tolerance.comment: This is the maximum tolerated difference between the cropped read length and minimal read length that will be retained.

mapped_read_length.title: Mapped read length (nt)
mapped_read_length.description: The length of the reads actually mapped, if the original read length was clipped.
mapped_read_length.comment: This is used when the original sequenced read length needed to be adjusted to match a replicate, or to match experiments and controls.

mapped_run_type.title: Mapped run type for bam files
mapped_run_type.description: The mapped run type of the alignment file which may differ from the fastqs it is derived from.
mapped_run_type.comment: When the control and experiment run types do not match, one may be changed in order to meet pipeline requirements.

read_name_details.title: Fastq read name details
read_name_details.description: For high-throughput sequencing FASTQ files, details of the read name structure
read_name_details.comment: Zero-based position of flowcell, lane, etc. information within FASTQ read names splitted using space and : as delimiters

flowcell_id_location.title: Flowcell identifier location
flowcell_id_location.description: Location of the flowcell identifier in the read name
flowcell_id_location.comment: Zero-based location of the flowcell identifier in the read name, if you split read name using space and : as delimiters

lane_id_location.title: Lane identifier location
lane_id_location.description: Location of the lane identifier in the read name
lane_id_location.comment: Zero-based location of the lane identifier in the read name, if you split the read name using space and : as delimiters

read_number_location.title: Read number (1 or 2) identifier location
read_number_location.description: Location of the read number in the read name
read_number_location.comment: Zero-based location of the read number in the read name, if you split the read name using space and : as delimiters

barcode_location.title: Barcode location
barcode_location.description: Location of the barcode in the read name
barcode_location.comment: Zero-based location of the barcode in the read name, if you split the read name using space and : as delimiters

flowcell_details.title: Flowcell details
flowcell_details.description: For high-throughput sequencing, the flowcells used for the sequencing of the replicate.

machine.title: Machine Name
machine.description: The lab specific name of the machine used.

barcode_in_read.title: Barcode in read
barcode_in_read.description: The read the barcode is located on.

barcode_position.title: Barcode position
barcode_position.description: The 1-based start position of the barcode in 5->3 orientation.

chunk.title: Chunk
chunk.description: The file chunk label as assigned by Illumina software when splitting up a fastq into specified chunk sizes.
chunk.comment: This label is used to re-assemble the chunks into the original file in the correct order.

index_of.title: Index of
index_of.description: The files this index file is relevant for.

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

output_type.description: A description of the file's purpose or contents.

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

items.comment: The files in this list should be archived or revoked.

dataset.description: The experiment or dataset the file belongs to.
dataset.comment: Required. See dataset.json for available identifiers.

replicate.title: Replicate
replicate.description: The experimental replicate designation for the file.
replicate.comment: This field is required for sra and fastq files. See replicate.json for available identifiers.

assembly.title: Genome assembly
assembly.description: Genome assembly that files were mapped to.
assembly.comment: Required property for bam, sam, gtf, idx, gff, bed and bigBed file format files. This property should not be submitted with sra or fastq files. The order of enums below reflects the priority when we consider selecting default analysis for a dataset.

genome_annotation.title: Genome annotation
genome_annotation.description: Genome annotation that file was generated with.
genome_annotation.comment: Applies to files created using annotations. The order of enums below reflects the priority when we consider selecting default analysis for a dataset.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the file object.
status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of file submission.

dbxrefs.description: Identifiers from external resources that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit.  This is for admins to make virtual file objects for files at external resources.

items.description: Identifier from an external resource that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.

step_run.title: Analysis step run
step_run.description: The run instance of the step used to generate the file.
step_run.comment: This may be linked to an individual instance at DNANexus or it may be virtual and have many files linked to it.

restriction_enzymes.title: Restriction enzymes

items.title: Restriction enzyme
items.description: The name of a restriction enzyme

content_error_detail.title: Content error detail
content_error_detail.description: Explanation of why the file failed the automated content checks.

revoke_detail.title: Revoke error detail
revoke_detail.description: Explanation of why the file was revoked.
revoke_detail.comment: Do not submit. The field would be posted by DCC.

read_structure.title: Read structure
read_structure.description: A list of elements in the read describing the structure of a read.

items.description: One element in the read with start and end coordinates.

start.title: Start coordinate
start.description: The 1-based start coordinate within the read. A negative number stands for a position counting from the end of the read.

end.title: End coordinate
end.description: The 1-based end coordinate within the read. A negative number stands for a position counting from the end of the read.

matching_md5sum.title: Matching md5sum
matching_md5sum.description: Array of files which have a matching md5sum.
matching_md5sum.comment: Do not submit. This field is updated by checkfiles.

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

preferred_default.title: Preferred default file
preferred_default.description: A flag to indicate whether this file should be used by default for purposes such as downloading, visualization, etc.

hotspots_prefix.title: Hotspots prefix
hotspots_prefix.description: Prefix to be checked and specified only for hotspots1 reference and hotspots2 reference files.

filter_type.description: Type of threshold used for filtering data, for example MAPQ (mapping quality) for alignments, or FDR percentage for peak calls.
filter_type.comment: The filter_type property requires specification of filter_value property.

filter_value.title: Filter value
filter_value.description: Numerical value representing the threshold used to filter the processed data.
filter_value.comment: The filter_value property requires specification of filter_type property.

title.description: The title of the file either the accession or the external_accession.
title.comment: Do not submit. This is a calculated property

href.comment: Do not submit. This is issued by the server.

upload_credentials.title: Upload Credentials

upload_credentials.comment: Do not submit. This is issued by the server.

read_length_units.title: Read length units
read_length_units.comment: Do not submit. This is a fixed value.

technical_replicates.title: Technical replicates

items.title: Technical replicate number
items.description: The identifying number of each relevant technical replicate

GeneticModification.title: Genetic Modification
GeneticModification.description: Schema for submitting information on genetic modification.

purpose.comment: Modifications for tagging purposes need to include the introduced_tag property in combination with a target. Modifications for other purposes also need either the site and/or target specified.

category.comment: Insertions need to specify introduced_tags, introduced_sequence, introduced_gene, or introduced_elements at either modified_site_nonspecific or specifying gRNAs and CRISPR machinery. Replacements need to specify introduced_sequence. Deletions need either target id, coordinates or deleted sequence specified. Interference needs target id specified (unless the purpose is characterization and method is CRISPR) and mutagenesis needs treatment specified. Episome needs to specify introduced_elements.

introduced_tags.comment: Specified introduced protein tags should include at least one entry and apply only to tagging modifications.

introduced_elements.comment: introduced_elements are currently restricted to sets of indeterminate elements to be characterized either on episome or inserted randomly; or the general introduction of guide RNAs and CRISPR machinery prior to a CRISPR screen.

guide_rna_sequences.comment: Guide RNA sequences apply only to modification_technique = CRISPR.

rnai_sequences.comment: RNAi sequences apply only to modification_technique = RNAi, for interference and the purposes of repression only.

RVD_sequence_pairs.comment: RVD sequence pairs apply only to modification_technique = TALEN and should include at least one entry but no more than two.

introduced_sequence.comment: Introduced sequences apply only to category = insertion, replacement, or transgene insertion.

reagents.comment: Specified reagent availablity details should include at least one entry.

treatments.comment: Only treatments for mutagenesis and site-specific recombination should be specified.

method.comment: CRISPR technique requires guide_rna_sequences and/or reagent_availability specified. RNAi requires rnai_sequences and/or reagent availability specified. Specification of reagents for RNAi is not required if the RNAi was a result of a cross between two modified fly strains. TALEs require zygosity, RVD_sequence_pairs and/or reagent_availability specified. Mutagen treatment needs treatment to be specified. All other techniques need reagent_availability and/or supporting documents to be specified.

introduced_gene.comment: The property introduced_gene is not allowed for modifications of method RNAi or mutagen_treatment.

MOI.comment: Multiplicity of infection only applies to a viral nucleic_acid_delivery_method, transduction.

guide_type.comment: Design of the guide types should be described in a GeneticModification that describes delivery of the guides to the sample.

RVD_sequence_pairs.title: RVD sequence pairs

RVD_sequence_pairs.comment: Each cut should be specified by a pair. No more than two pairs should be specified per genetic_modification.

left_RVD_sequence.title: Left RVD sequence
left_RVD_sequence.description: The repeat variable diresidue sequence of the left half-site for recognized by the TAL effector at a particular location. e.g. NI,NG,NI,HD,NG,NN,NG,NG,NN,HD,NI,NI,NI,NI,NM,HD,HD,NG

right_RVD_sequence.title: Right RVD sequence
right_RVD_sequence.description: The repeat variable diresidue sequence of the right half-site for recognized by the TAL effector at a particular location. e.g. NI,NG,NI,HD,NG,NN,NG,NG,NN,HD,NI,NI,NI,NI,NM,HD,HD,NG

fri_dhs.title: Fraction of DHS reads
fri_dhs.description: Fraction of reads in universal DHS regions

fri_exclusion_list.title: Fraction of reads in regions from exclusion list

fri_prom.title: Fraction of reads in promoter regions

fri_enh.title: Fraction of reads in enhancer regions

estimated_fragment_len.title: Estimated fragment length
estimated_fragment_len.description: Fragment length/strandshift. This is the estimated fragment length/strand shift for each dataset as estimated by strand shift cross-correlation analysis

corr_estimated_fragment_len.title: Correlation at estimated fragment length
corr_estimated_fragment_len.description: Value of correlation function at estimated fragment length.

min_corr.title: Correlation minimum
min_corr.description: Minimum cross-correlation over a sufficiently wide range of strand shifts (typically -100 bp to ~3 times the expected size of DNA fragments based on sonication and size selection protocols).

NSC.title: Normalized strand cross-correlation
NSC.description: Normalized strand cross-correlation = FRAGLEN_CC / MIN_CC. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at estimated fragment length to the minimum cross-correlation over all shifts.

RSC.title: Relative strand cross-correlation coefficient
RSC.description: Relative cross-correlation coefficient. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at fragment length and at read length

href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

auc.title: AUC of the plot
auc.description: The “area under the curve”, with a maximum value of 0.5. Lower values generally indicate higher and more focal enrichment.

syn_auc.title: Synthetic AUC
syn_auc.description: The expected area under the curve of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed AUC into perspective.

x_intercept.title: X-intercept
x_intercept.description: The point (on the X-axis) at which the curve is 0. This is approximately the percentage of the genome that was not sequenced in a particular sample.

syn_x_intercept.title: Synthetic X-intercept
syn_x_intercept.description: The expected X-intercept of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed X-intercept into perspective.

elbow_pt.title: Elbow point
elbow_pt.description: The elbow point attempts to measure the position at which the line turns upward. In practice, this is the point at which the plotted line is furthest from the line from the lower-left to the upper-right corner of the graph (equivalent to a perfect input sample with infinite coverage). The point returned is the position on the X-axis of this elbow point and higher values indicate more enrichment.

syn_elbow_pt.title: Synthetic elbow point
syn_elbow_pt.description: The expected elbow point of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed elbow point into perspective.

jsd.title: JS distance
jsd.description: The Jensen-Shannon distance between the replicate and the control.

syn_jsd.title: Synthetic JS distance
syn_jsd.description: The Jensen-Shannon distance between a given sample and a perfect input sample with the same coverage depth (i.e., the plot generated from the Poisson probability mass function with lambda equal to the mean coverage in the sample).

pct_genome_enrich.title: Percentage of genome enriched
pct_genome_enrich.description: The approximate percentage of the genome enriched in signal (e.g., bound by a transcription factor or having a certain histone modification).

diff_enrich.title: Differential enrichment
diff_enrich.description: The differential enrichment between a given sample and that indicated by --JSDsample at the elbow point.

ch_div.title: CHANCE divergence
ch_div.description: The CHANCE divergence between the replicate and the control.

positions_with_one_read.description: Number of locations to which exactly one read (pair) maps

NRF.title: Non-redundant fraction
NRF.description: Non-redundant fraction (indicates library complexity).  Number of distinct unique mapping reads (i.e. after removing duplicates) / Total number of reads

PBC1.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 1
PBC1.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 1 = M1/M_DISTINCT where M1: number of genomic locations where exactly one read maps uniquely, M_DISTINCT: number of distinct genomic locations to which some read maps uniquely

PBC2.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 2
PBC2.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 2 (indicates library complexity) = M1/M2 where M1: number of genomic locations where only one read maps uniquely and M2: number of genomic locations where 2 reads map uniquely

estimated_fragment_len.title: Estimated fragment length
estimated_fragment_len.description: Fragment length/strandshift. This is the estimated fragment length/strand shift for each dataset as estimated by strand shift cross-correlation analysis

corr_estimated_fragment_len.title: Correlation at estimated fragment length
corr_estimated_fragment_len.description: Value of correlation function at estimated fragment length.

min_corr.title: Correlation minimum
min_corr.description: Minimum cross-correlation over a sufficiently wide range of strand shifts (typically -100 bp to ~3 times the expected size of DNA fragments based on sonication and size selection protocols).

NSC.title: Normalized strand cross-correlation
NSC.description: Normalized strand cross-correlation = FRAGLEN_CC / MIN_CC. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at estimated fragment length to the minimum cross-correlation over all shifts.

RSC.title: Relative strand cross-correlation coefficient
RSC.description: Relative cross-correlation coefficient. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at fragment length and at read length

href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

auc.title: AUC of the plot
auc.description: The “area under the curve”, with a maximum value of 0.5. Lower values generally indicate higher and more focal enrichment.

syn_auc.title: Synthetic AUC
syn_auc.description: The expected area under the curve of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed AUC into perspective.

x_intercept.title: X-intercept
x_intercept.description: The point (on the X-axis) at which the curve is 0. This is approximately the percentage of the genome that was not sequenced in a particular sample.

syn_x_intercept.title: Synthetic X-intercept
syn_x_intercept.description: The expected X-intercept of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed X-intercept into perspective.

elbow_pt.title: Elbow point
elbow_pt.description: The elbow point attempts to measure the position at which the line turns upward. In practice, this is the point at which the plotted line is furthest from the line from the lower-left to the upper-right corner of the graph (equivalent to a perfect input sample with infinite coverage). The point returned is the position on the X-axis of this elbow point and higher values indicate more enrichment.

syn_elbow_pt.title: Synthetic elbow point
syn_elbow_pt.description: The expected elbow point of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed elbow point into perspective.

jsd.title: JS distance
jsd.description: The Jensen-Shannon distance between the replicate and the control.

syn_jsd.title: Synthetic JS distance
syn_jsd.description: The Jensen-Shannon distance between a given sample and a perfect input sample with the same coverage depth (i.e., the plot generated from the Poisson probability mass function with lambda equal to the mean coverage in the sample).

pct_genome_enrich.title: Percentage of genome enriched
pct_genome_enrich.description: The approximate percentage of the genome enriched in signal (e.g., bound by a transcription factor or having a certain histone modification).

diff_enrich.title: Differential enrichment
diff_enrich.description: The differential enrichment between a given sample and that indicated by --JSDsample at the elbow point.

ch_div.title: CHANCE divergence
ch_div.description: The CHANCE divergence between the replicate and the control.

href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

positions_with_one_read.title: Locations with one mapped read
positions_with_one_read.description: Number of locations to which exactly one read (pair) maps

NRF.title: Non-redundant fraction
NRF.description: Non redundant fraction (indicates library complexity).  Number of distinct unique mapping reads (i.e. after removing duplicates) / Total number of reads

PBC1.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 1
PBC1.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 1 = M1/M_DISTINCT where M1: number of genomic locations where exactly one read maps uniquely, M_DISTINCT: number of distinct genomic locations to which some read maps uniquely

PBC2.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 2
PBC2.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 2 (indicates library complexity) = M1/M2 where M1: number of genomic locations where only one read maps uniquely and M2: number of genomic locations where 2 reads map uniquely

NSC.title: Normalized strand cross-correlation
NSC.description: Normalized strand cross-correlation = FRAGLEN_CC / MIN_CC. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at estimated fragment length to the minimum cross-correlation over all shifts.

RSC.title: Relative cross correlation coefficient
RSC.description: Relative cross correlation coefficient. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at fragment length  and at read length

PBC1.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 1
PBC1.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 1 = M1/M_DISTINCT where M1: number of genomic locations where exactly one read maps uniquely, M_DISTINCT: number of distinct genomic locations to which some read maps uniquely

PBC2.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 2
PBC2.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 2 (indicates library complexity) = M1/M2 where M1: number of genomic locations where only one read maps uniquely and M2: number of genomic locations where 2 reads map uniquely

fragment length.title: Fragment length
fragment length.description: Fragment length/strandshift. This is the estimated fragment length/strand shift for each dataset as estimated by strand cross-correlation analysis

NRF.title: Non-redundant fraction
NRF.description: Non redundant fraction (indicates library complexity).  Number of distinct unique mapping reads (i.e. after removing duplicates) / Total number of reads

Mt_tRNA.title: Mt tRNA

TEC.description: To be Experimentally Confirmed. This is used for non-spliced EST clusters that have polyA features. This category has been specifically created for the ENCODE project to highlight regions that could indicate the presence of protein coding genes that require experimental validation, either by 5' RACE or RT-PCR to extend the transcripts, or by confirming expression of the putatively-encoded peptide with specific antibodies.
TEC.title: TEC

number_of_genes_detected.title: gene

lincRNA.description: Long, intervening noncoding (linc) RNA that can be found in evolutionarily conserved, intergenic regions.
lincRNA.title: lincRNA

macro_lncRNA.description: Unspliced lncRNA that is several kb in size.
macro_lncRNA.title: macro lncRNA

miRNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
miRNA.title: miRNA

misc_RNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
misc_RNA.title: misc RNA

non_coding.description: Transcript which is known from the literature to not be protein coding.
non_coding.title: non coding

polymorphic_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene owing to a SNP/DIP but in other individuals/haplotypes/strains the gene is translated.
polymorphic_pseudogene.title: polymorphic pseudogene

processed_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene that lack introns and is thought to arise from reverse transcription of mRNA followed by reinsertion of DNA into the genome.
processed_pseudogene.title: processed pseudogene

pseudogene.description: Have homology to proteins but generally suffer from a disrupted coding sequence and an active homologous gene can be found at another locus. Sometimes these entries have an intact coding sequence or an open but truncated ORF, in which case there is other evidence used (for example genomic polyA stretches at the 3' end) to classify them as a pseudogene. Can be further classified as one of the following.
pseudogene.title: pseudogene

rRNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
rRNA.title: rRNA

ribozyme.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
ribozyme.title: ribozyme

sRNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
sRNA.title: sRNA

scaRNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
scaRNA.title: scaRNA

sense_intronic.description: Long non-coding transcript in introns of a coding gene that does not overlap any exons.
sense_intronic.title: sense intronic

sense_overlapping.description: Long non-coding transcript that contains a coding gene in its intron on the same strand.
sense_overlapping.title: sense overlapping

snRNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
snRNA.title: snRNA

snoRNA.description: Non-coding RNA predicted using sequences from Rfam and miRBase
snoRNA.title: snoRNA

transcribed_processed_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene where protein homology or genomic structure indicates a pseudogene, but the presence of locus-specific transcripts indicates expression.
transcribed_processed_pseudogene.title: transcribed processed pseudogene

transcribed_unitary_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene where protein homology or genomic structure indicates a pseudogene, but the presence of locus-specific transcripts indicates expression.
transcribed_unitary_pseudogene.title: transcribed unitary pseudogene

transcribed_unprocessed_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene where protein homology or genomic structure indicates a pseudogene, but the presence of locus-specific transcripts indicates expression.
transcribed_unprocessed_pseudogene.title: transcribed unprocessed pseudogene

translated_unprocessed_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene that has mass spec data suggesting that it is also translated.
translated_unprocessed_pseudogene.title: translated unprocessed pseudogene

unitary_pseudogene.description: A species-specific unprocessed pseudogene without a parent gene, as it has an active orthologue in another species.
unitary_pseudogene.title: unitary pseudogene

unprocessed_pseudogene.description: Pseudogene that can contain introns since produced by gene duplication.
unprocessed_pseudogene.title: unprocessed pseudogene

vaultRNA.description: Short non coding RNA gene that forms part of the vault ribonucleoprotein complex.
vaultRNA.title: vaultRNA

NRF.title: Non-redundant fraction
NRF.description: Non-redundant fraction (indicates library complexity).  Number of distinct unique mapping reads (i.e. after removing duplicates) / Total number of reads

PBC1.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 1
PBC1.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 1 = M1/M_DISTINCT where M1: number of genomic locations where exactly one read maps uniquely, M_DISTINCT: number of distinct genomic locations to which some read maps uniquely

PBC2.title: PCR bottlenecking coefficient 2
PBC2.description: PCR Bottlenecking coefficient 2 (indicates library complexity) = M1/M2 where M1: number of genomic locations where only one read maps uniquely and M2: number of genomic locations where 2 reads map uniquely

dbxrefs.title: External resources
dbxrefs.description: Unique identifiers from external resources (e.g. UniProtKB or FactorBook).

items.title: External identifier
items.description: A unique identifier from external resource (e.g. UniProtKB or FactorBook).
items.comment: Submit as database name:target name (e.g. FactorBook:HMFN0395)

target_organism.title: Target organism
target_organism.comment: This property is for targets which don't have any associated genes. This property and the "genes" property are mutually exclusive. See organism.json for available identifiers.

genes.title: Targeted genes
genes.description: List of gene(s) targeted by corresponding assay or antibody.
genes.comment: See gene.json for available identifiers and details.

items.title: Targeted Gene
items.description: A gene targeted by corresponding assay or antibody.
items.comment: See gene.json for available identifiers and details.

modifications.title: Target modification
modifications.description: List of modifications made to the corresponding gene product of this target.
modifications.comment: This property will be used to calculate the proper label of the target. See computed_label property for details about automatic label calculation.

items.title: Modification
items.description: A modification to the gene product.

modification.title: Type of modification
modification.description: One specific modifications listed in the enum.

position.title: Amino acid position
position.description: The numeric position (one based) of modified amino acid in the protein.
position.comment: It worth noting that the first Methionine on newly transcribed peptide is usually cleaved through N-terminal methionine excision (NME). Therefore, this cleaved Methionine will not be taken into account and the amino acid right after it is position 1.

amino_acid_code.title: Modified amino acid
amino_acid_code.description: One letter IUPAC amino acid code.

label.title: Target label
label.description: Common name for the target including post-translational modifications, if any.
label.comment: Submit the common name of the gene with modification (e.g. H3K4me3, eGFP-E2F1, or POLR2AphosphoS2).

investigated_as.title: Target category
investigated_as.description: The context(s) the target was investigated in

organism.title: Organism
organism.comment: Calculated from either target_organism or genes

uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with every object.
uuid.comment: Do not submit. The uuid is set by the server.

schema_version.comment: Do not submit. The version used to validate the object is set by the server. The default should be set to the current version.

lab.description: Lab user is primarily associated with.
lab.comment: See lab.json for available identifiers.

submits_for.title: Submits for
submits_for.description: Labs user is authorized to submit data for.

items.description: A lab user is authorized to submit for.
items.comment: See lab.json for available identifiers.

viewing_groups.title: View access group
viewing_groups.description: The group that determines which set of data the user has permission to view.
